intro: Stemmadenia guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan stemmadenia, is a shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant has woody stems that are often covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges. It produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, smooth seeds.
